channel.title: Joining the White Knights
channel.description:
[center]I was looking over some quest guides for some ideas and I read the quest "Wanted." Once finishing, you are able to open up a White Armor shop, depending on your kill count of black knights. This gave me an idea. I have just added somewhat my own version of that, this is what I have so far.[/center]
[img]http://i42.tinypic.com/rmimu1.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i43.tinypic.com/2cacux.jpg[/img]
[img]http://i44.tinypic.com/t9dzqe.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/nmylms.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/1gnbwz.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/25kmqkl.png[/img]
[IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/3580xvb.png[/img]
[img]http://i41.tinypic.com/rm8a3p.png[/img]
[center]Anything I should improve?[/center]
[center][b]Credits[/b] `Rich, Moo Dragon, JaydenD12[/center]

item.title: Joining the White Knights
item.dc:creator: @shrogg shrogg
item.description:
@shrogg wrote:

thats a good idea Kihomura.

Read full topic

item.title: Joining the White Knights
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

masta toxik:

Doesn’t peon come before novice? lol

In RuneScape, Novice is 100 kills, Peon 200 kills, Page at 300, Noble at 500, Adept at 800 and Master at 1300.

[quote=“shrogg, post:15, topic:257223”]lol ty P I M P 3d Tut

so Kihomura, how far are you through this now?

cheers, shrogg[/quote]

I’m thinking about making it so when you kill White Knights, they subtract from your kill count, as they do in RuneScape.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @masta_toxik masta toxik
item.description:
@masta_toxik wrote:

Doesn’t peon come before novice? lol

item.title: Joining the White Knights
item.dc:creator: @P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut `Lewk_
item.description:
@P_I_M_P_3_D_Tut wrote:

[quote=“shrogg, post:11, topic:257223”]this look realy cool, when are you going to relece?
im realy intrested

shrogg[/quote]
Please, For great justice. Learn to spell.
There’s a thing called grammar for a reason.

Let me fix that for you,

"This looks really cool; when are you going to release?
I’m really interested.

-Shrogg."

L2Firefoxspellcheck?

[quote=“Kihomura, post:8, topic:257223”][quote author=P I M P 3 D Tut link=topic=339620.msg2633129#msg2633129 date=1232321655]

[quote author=Kihomura link=topic=339620.msg2633126#msg2633126 date=1232321560]

Looks nice.
I don’t think there’s anything you can add.
It looks near perfect.
Good work.

Thanks. I’m thinking about making it harder to get the armor two, not having just two shops, but more like 4, but with the armors divided equally and the last shop will have all of them, still thinking about it though.
[/quote] Do you buy the armor with your points? Or with money?

With money, but I like that idea, never came across my mind. It might take a few adjustments, but I’ll see what I can do
[/quote] Yeah, 1 kill > 1 point?
And how do you find out how many points you have?
Every kill it sends you a message ?

Yeah, I’m thinking about changing that, due to chatbox overflowing, but if you talk to Sir Amik Varze, he has the option “May I please view my kill status?” and it tells you everything you need.

But yeah, I’m going to see if I can change it so you buy the items with your points, thanks for that idea.

Edit: Actually, I have another idea… Lol.

I just wrote up something, for the kill messages, I’m assuming that it will work.

} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 178) { int Player = npcs[i].StartKilling; client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player]; ppl.blkKnightKills += 1; if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 20) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 20 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 40) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 40 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 60) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 60 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 80) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 80 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 100) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 100 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills >= 120) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed quite a few Black Knights, great job!"); }

It will now tell you how many kills you have per 20 kills, but Sir Amik Varze will tell you your exact number, say if you have 325 kills, he will tell you that.

Edit: Works ;)[/quote] That’s a really good idea.
Looks nice ;).

Read full topic

item.title: Joining the White Knights
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

[quote=“P I M P 3 D Tut, post:7, topic:257223”][quote author=Kihomura link=topic=339620.msg2633126#msg2633126 date=1232321560]

[quote author=P I M P 3 D Tut link=topic=339620.msg2633118#msg2633118 date=1232321422]

Looks nice.
I don’t think there’s anything you can add.
It looks near perfect.
Good work.

Thanks. I’m thinking about making it harder to get the armor two, not having just two shops, but more like 4, but with the armors divided equally and the last shop will have all of them, still thinking about it though.
[/quote] Do you buy the armor with your points? Or with money?

With money, but I like that idea, never came across my mind. It might take a few adjustments, but I’ll see what I can do
[/quote] Yeah, 1 kill > 1 point?
And how do you find out how many points you have?
Every kill it sends you a message ?[/quote]

Yeah, I’m thinking about changing that, due to chatbox overflowing, but if you talk to Sir Amik Varze, he has the option “May I please view my kill status?” and it tells you everything you need.

But yeah, I’m going to see if I can change it so you buy the items with your points, thanks for that idea.

Edit: Actually, I have another idea… Lol.

I just wrote up something, for the kill messages, I’m assuming that it will work.

} else if (npcs[i].npcType == 178) { int Player = npcs[i].StartKilling; client ppl = (client) server.playerHandler.players[Player]; ppl.blkKnightKills += 1; if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 20) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 20 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 40) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 40 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 60) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 60 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 80) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 80 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills == 100) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed 100 Black Knights so far, the White Knights are depending on you!"); } if (ppl.blkKnightKills >= 120) { ppl.sendMessage("You have killed quite a few Black Knights, great job!"); }

It will now tell you how many kills you have per 20 kills, but Sir Amik Varze will tell you your exact number, say if you have 325 kills, he will tell you that.

Edit: Works
